Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: initial MAIA implementation \(Phase 1 - Foundation\)

- BadgerDB storage layer with full CRUD operations for memories and namespaces
- REST API server with Gin framework
- Configuration management with Viper
- Structured logging with Zap
- 20 unit tests passing with good coverage
- AICoF workflow setup with adapted prompt.md

MAIA is an AI-native distributed memory system that acts as an intelligent
interceptor between applications and LLMs. It solves the fundamental problem
of context window limitations by intelligently managing what information
goes into that window.

Key differentiators:
- Distributed-first architecture \(vs centralized approaches\)
- Position-aware context assembly \(solves "context rot"\)
- Sub-200ms latency target
- Flexible namespace model
- Multiple integration patterns \(MCP, proxy, SDK\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

feat\(intelligence\): implement Phase 2 - query understanding and retrieval

Phase 2 \(Intelligence\) implementation includes:

- Embedding package with mock provider for testing
  - Provider interface for embedding generation
  - Cosine similarity and vector normalization utilities
  - Deterministic mock provider for reproducible tests

- Vector index with HNSW implementation
  - BruteForce index for small datasets/testing
  - HNSW \(Hierarchical Navigable Small World\) for efficient ANN search
  - Search returns results sorted by similarity score

- Full-text search with Bleve
  - Document indexing with namespace, tags, and type fields
  - Query filtering by namespace, tags, and type
  - Highlighting support for matched content

- Query analyzer for understanding user intent
  - Intent detection \(question, command, search, conversation\)
  - Keyword extraction with stopword filtering
  - Entity extraction \(dates, names\)
  - Context type determination \(semantic, episodic, working\)
  - Temporal scope inference
  - Token budget suggestions

- Multi-strategy retrieval
  - Combines vector search, full-text search, and storage fallback
  - Configurable weights for different scoring factors
  - Relevance scorer with recency and frequency components

All components include comprehensive unit tests.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
